fields.description: Arista NetworksSoftware EngineerSanta Clara, CA, USAFull-timeJob DescriptionThe core responsibility is to deliver product features. A major part of this is writing the code that drives our products. But the role of a software engineer is much bigger than just being a coding machine. Software engineers work on the whole development process, including:deciding what features to builddriving the designwriting the code (of course)pushing testingdocumenting the featuresupporting customers in the fieldAlong the way, you might:extend and improve the test infrastructurehack on our engineering tools, including p4, django, python, rpm, ...work with sales and business developmentimprove the content on our website The Person:If you...love to programenjoy building things and shipping them, truly making them workfind satisfaction in creating a really well-written piece of codecare about keeping the code maintainable and preserving its integritylook for a better way, and strive to make it realcare about the business tooenjoy working with others who feel the samelearn how things work, just for fun or out of curiosity... then this job is for you. QualificationsA strong background in Linux, C++, TCP/IP, python, hardware, drivers, compilers, or assembly language is a plus. A BSCS/CE degree is required.Additional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.Privacy PolicyCookies SettingsSHARE THIS JOBOTHER JOBS AT ARISTA NETWORKSPlatform Software EngineerSanta Clara, CAPlatform Software EngineerNashua, NHNetwork Systems Engineer (Pre-Sales)Santa Clara, CAShow all jobsSIMILAR JOBSSoftware Engineer/ Tools Software EngineerInfotree Service IncChandler, AZSoftware EngineerArista NetworksNashua, NHSoftware EngineerArista NetworksSan Francisco, CAPowered by (Data Processor)Privacy Policy and Terms of UseSoftware EngineerSanta Clara, CA, USAFull-time

fields.description: Airkit LogoApply NowBack End Engineerat Airkit (View all jobs)Work from anywhereAbout UsAirkit is on a mission to empower companies to build experiences people love.  People come first in every aspect of what we do, both internally and externally. We are looking for driven and enthusiastic individuals who want to work together to help build a company from the ground-up. About the role: As to be expected in a fast moving start-up, the scope of this position will evolve continuously. Comfort with ambiguity is required. Below is a partial description of the valuable qualities we are looking for in a candidate for a Back End Engineer:Consistent track record of designing, developing, testing, deploying, maintaining, and improving softwareComfort leading individual project priorities, deadlines and resultsConsistent track record of execution and delivery; ability to get stuff done Development process flexibility; ability to build software in fast iterative cycles Demonstrated passion for coding and problem solving, either within a startup environment and/or side projects in an academic environmentStrength in collaborating multi-functionally across engineering, design, and productOption to work remotely or from our Palo Alto, CA officeA great candidate for this position has: BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience. Software development experience in one or more general purpose programming languages. Experience working with two or more from the following: Unix/Linux environments, distributed and parallel systems, machine learning, information retrieval, natural language processing, networking, developing large software systems, and/or security software development. A working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written EnglishBonus points for Kotlin, Java, JVM, Node and DockerTech StackBackend: Kotlin, Flyway, jOOQ, Gradle, Node Infrastructure: AWS, Postgres, DynamoDB, Redis, Lambda, Kubernetes, Vault, Consul, Terraform, Spinnaker Front End: Typescript, React, ReduxNot everyone will match the above qualifications 100%. If your experiences dont perfectly align, but you think youd be a great fit, wed still love to hear from you.Airkit is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.Apply for this Job* RequiredFirst Name *MacallanLast Name *SavettEmail *jsavett@gmail.comPhone8054510363Resume/CV   Macallan Savett SWE Resume.pdf Cover LetterAttach Dropbox Google Drive PasteLinkedIn ProfileWebsitePowered by  Greenhouse LogoRead our Privacy PolicyNo file chosenvc4cvzeisakNo file chosen

Below is a partial description of the valuable qualities we are looking for in the ideal candidate for a Front End Engineer:Ability to design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve softwareComfort leading individual project priorities, deadlines and resultsConsistent track record of execution and delivery; ability to get stuff done Development process flexibility; ability to build software in fast iterative cycles Demonstrated passion for coding and problem solving, either within a startup environment and/or personal or academic projectsStrength in collaborating multi-functionally across engineering, design, and productOption to work remotely or from our Palo Alto, CA officeA great candidate for this position has: BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experienceExpert level knowledge of JavaScript, CSS, HTMLExperience with a JavaScript framework such as React, Vue.js, Angular, or EmberSoftware development experience in one or more general purpose programming languagesA working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written EnglishDemonstrated empathy for design and UX methodologiesBonus points for Typescript, ES6, LESS, ReduxTech StackFront End: Typescript, React, ReduxBackend: Kotlin, Flyway, jOOQ, Gradle, Node Infrastructure: AWS, Postgres, DynamoDB, Redis, Lambda, Kubernetes, Vault, Consul, Terraform, Spinnaker Not everyone will match the above qualifications 100%. If your experiences dont perfectly align, but you think youd be a great fit, wed still love to hear from you.Airkit is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.Apply for this Job* RequiredFirst Name *Last Name *Email *PhoneResume/CVAttach Dropbox Google Drive PasteCover LetterAttach Dropbox Google Drive PasteLinkedIn ProfilePowered by  Greenhouse LogoRead our Privacy PolicyNo file chosenNo file chosen

fields.description: Airkit LogoApply NowFull Stack Engineerat Airkit (View all jobs)Work from anywhereAbout UsAirkit began in 2017 when co-founders Adam Evans and Stephen Ehikian got fed up with frustrating customer experiences.  They couldnt understand why, in the age of big data, AI, cloud-computing, and connected products, their interactions with companies were so impersonal, reactive, and time-consuming.  Our team previously founded and built RelateIQ (sold to Salesforce in 2014). Theyve witnessed first-hand the evolution of the relationship between companies and customers. Everyone and everything are now connected, and customer expectations are soaring.  Located in Palo Alto, CA, our company is on a mission to empower companies to build experiences people love. We are looking for smart and ambitious individuals who want to help build a company from the ground up.    A great candidate for this position has: As to be expected in a fast moving start-up, the scope of this position will evolve continuously. Comfort with ambiguity is required. Below is a partial description of the important qualities we are looking for in the ideal candidate:Proven ability to design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve softwareComfort managing individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables Track record of execution and delivery; ability to get stuff done Development process flexibility; ability to build software in fast iterative cycles Demonstrated passion for coding and problem solving, either within a startup environment and/or side projects in an academic environmentStrength in collaborating cross-functionally across engineering, design, and productOption to work remotely or from our Palo Alto, CA officeMinimum QualificationsBS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience. Software development experience in one or more general purpose programming languages. Experience working with two or more from the following: web application development, Unix/Linux environments, mobile application development, distributed and parallel systems, machine learning, information retrieval, natural language processing, networking, developing large software systems, and/or security software development. Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English.Tech StackBackend: Kotlin, Gradle, Node Infrastructure: AWS, Postgres, DynamoDB, Redis, Lambda, Kubernetes, Vault, Consul, Terraform, Spinnaker Front End: Typescript, React, Redux, Socket.ioNot everyone will match the above qualifications 100%. If your experiences dont perfectly align, but you think youd be a great fit, wed still love to hear from you.Airkit is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.  Apply for this Job* RequiredFirst Name *Last Name *Email *PhoneResume/CVAttach Dropbox Google Drive PasteCover LetterAttach Dropbox Google Drive PasteLinkedIn ProfilePowered by  Greenhouse LogoRead our Privacy PolicyNo file chosenNo file chosen

fields.description: Job Description: Responsible for designing and developing a web application using Python web framework Flask that can theoretically scale horizontally to any number of users. Design the Python script which connects to the RabbitMQ server and extract the messages and inserts into the MySQL table. Generated Talend Script to push the data from hive table to the Teradata. Design functional and technical specification documents.Experience/Qualifications: Masters or foreign academic equivalent in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Science, Engineering related any field plus one (1) years of experience in job offered or related field. Experience in two or more following tools:  Python script, MySQL, RabbitMQ, JSON, C++, JavaScript, RestAPI, and Tableau is required. May travel to client sites within the U.S.* In lieu will accept BS or foreign equivalency in above plus five (5) years of related progressive experience. Will accept any suitable combination of education, training or experience for job offered. (JN-A)

fields.description: 3+ years history of development full-stack applications. Expertise in Java required.Demonstrated track record of successfully developing full-stack features by writing code that is readable, testable, maintainable, and scalableExpert at delivering high-quality features on ambitious timelinesDemonstrated knowledge and hands-on experience across the full application stack with some of the following languages/frameworks   UI: JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Angular, Vue, jquery  API: Java, Sprint, C#, .NET, Node.jsDatabases: SQL, MySQL, SQL Server, MongoDB, cloud-native databasesKnowledge of cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) or DevOps (e.g., Jenkins, Docker, Circle CI, Travis) is a plusExperience writing unit tests with major frameworks (Karma, JUnit, NUnit, MSTest) and practicing test-driven Experience working in Agile teams including active participation in sprint ceremonies (Daily Standup, Backlog Refinement, Retrospectives)Experience pair programming collaboratively with other developers, experience working with technical and non-technical colleaguesProven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activitiesSkills to communicate complex ideas effectively Undergraduate degree; or equivalent experienceWilling to travel WHO YOU'LL WORK WITHYoull work with McKinsey Digital in one of our North American offices. McKinsey Digital brings together the best of McKinseys tech and analytics capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses. As part of this group, youll join a global team working on everything from IT modernization and strategy to agile, cloud, cybersecurity, and digital transformation. Youll typically work on projects across all industries and functions and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm.Youll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses.Our office culture is casual, fun and social, with an emphasis on education and innovation. We have the freedom to try new ideas, experiment and are expected to be constantly learning and growing. There is also a strong emphasis on mentoring others in the group, enabling them to grow and learn. WHAT YOU'LL DOYou will work with clients in a wide range of sectors and industries, advising them on how to best use technology. We work in small cross-functional teams in a highly collaborative way, and enjoy seeing the direct impact from our work. Youll use your technical skills in an Agile environment to turn clients ambitions into reality. This includes hands-on, ground up development as well as coaching and mentoring our client teams to enable best practices while working towards delivering new software products and services.Along with developing clients technical capabilities, youll also change their cultures. From individual coaching to team mentoring, youll work to ensure a lasting change to the way clients work.

fields.description: My DashboardMcKinsey & Company HomeCareersHomeExploreOur PeopleSearch JobsInterviewingStudentsExperienced ProfessionalsMoreTechnology & DigitalSoftware Architect - Site Reliability EngineeringPragueApply NowQUALIFICATIONSExperience with DevOps processes and cultureExperience with DevOps tools for CI/CD, version control, Infrastructure as Code (e.g. GoCD, GitHub, Ansible, Terraform)Hands on experience with at least one of the major cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP)5+ years of experience in software engineering (e.g. Python, Go, Node.js, Ruby, and others)Comfortable in writing Infrastructure as Code using the same code quality and engineering practices expected from core application developers (Test driven development, Integration, Security, Acceptance testing)Understanding of web and database technologies, concepts and design elements of on premise, cloud based and hybrid architecturesStrong understanding of presentation tiers (Apache, Tomcat, Nginx, IIS)Experience with containerized environments (Kubernetes, Docker)Understanding of standard networking protocols and components such as: HTTP, DNS, TCP/IP, ICMP, Load Balancing and WAFKnowledge of (shell) scripting languages (e.g. Bash, PowerShell, Perl or other)Working experience with monitoring and data analysis tools (e.g. Splunk, Prometheus, Grafana, AppDynamics, ...)WHO YOU'LL WORK WITHYoull join our Prague office as part of our Cloud Native Tribe.This team is responsible for developing and operating private and public cloud hosting services. Your team members are located in different locations across the world (Germany, USA, Costa Rica, India). WHAT YOU'LL DOAs our company is moving fast from traditional IT world to digital era, you will use your developer skills and Site Reliability Engineering mindset to help us with the transformation. You will be working on a newly established Cloud Native Tribe. Together with the team you will build and run a self-service infrastructure orchestration layer on top of our on-premise IaaS and cloud providers, following the SRE model. You will actively contribute to and learn multiple technology skills (cloud, orchestration, network, operating system) with a strong focus on open source products.You will develop a vision for SRE within our organization, and you'll be a coach/mentor and help fellow team members to grow. You will be working with various product teams with focus on high application reliability, scalability and availability running in container infrastructure. You will be asked to  manage multiple complex projects and deadlines simultaneously. Additionally, you will focus heavily on automation and orchestration strategy for existing and new McKinsey IT infrastructure and contribute to Infrastructure as a code. IndustriesHigh TechFunctionsTechnologyApply NowFOR U.S. APPLICANTS: McKinsey & Company is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.FOR NON-U.S. APPLICANTS: McKinsey & Company is an Equal Opportunity employer. For additional details regarding our global EEO policy and diversity initiatives, please visit our McKinsey Careers and Diversity & Inclusion sites.SHARE THIS JOBMcKinsey&CompanyGet stories of our people & new job alerts once a weekSubscribe to our Careers BlogContact usCareers FAQPrivacy policyTerms of useLocal language informationAccessibility statementMcKinsey Insights - Get our latest thinking on your iPhone, iPad, or Android device.Download on the App Store Download Android app on Google Plays 1996-2020 McKinsey & Company

fields.description: Back To OpeningsSoftware DeveloperLocation:Princeton, NJ, United StatesJob ID:2381Number Of Positions:1START YOUR APPLICATIONAltimetrik is one of the fastest growing technology companies with a unique culture of combining people, creativity, and technology to ignite transformation. Teams developed in Altimetrik build innovative software solutions for the world's largest financial services, manufacturing, healthcare and retail companies. We place great importance on client relationships and have benefited from strong organic growth, which have allowed us to build a large blue-chip client base comprised of leading global companies across industries. Headquartered in Southfield, Michigan, Altimetrik is spread across the globe in the USA (Southfield, Princeton & San Francisco), India (Bengaluru, Chennai, Pune & Mumbai), Uruguay (Montevideo), Singapore and UAE (Sharjah) with a workforce of 2000 employees.Design and develop MyCIO portal that will be used by Command centerWork with customer product stake holders to fully understand business requirements to develop, architecture and design new systemsEnsure phased development delivery plan is executed on schedule and support the product implementation process and toolsDesign and development of the complete application from the start on already implemented company products.Meeting with business teams to understand the required functionality and prepare documentation to be presented in an efficient way. Work with business analysts to prepare the final requirement gathering documents and convert them to technical documents.Design backend databaseDevelop Data integrationsDevelop, create, and modify general computer applications software or specialized utility programs.Design and Develop API / micro services for each endpoint and ensure the implementation through acceptance testing, load testing etc.Provide KPIs (Key Performance Indicator) to the load testing teams, development teams and derive metrics. Review the metrics to make sure the expected results are achieved.Provide SLAs (Service Level Agreement), successful, failure and failover scenarios.Develop acceptance tests using Postman based upon user story acceptance criteria and integrate them in CI/CD Pipelines for automatic testing of code.Mentor and guide the development team to perform the code development in a timely manner without compromising with the deadlines. Basic qualifications: Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Software engineering or a related fieldAltimetrik is an equal opportunity employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status or protected veteran status or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.START YOUR APPLICATIONApplicant Tracking System Powered by ClearCompany HRM Applicant Tracking System

fields.description: Skip to Main ContentAmerican ExpressLife at American Express Our Company Career Areas Students Talent CommunityBackFront-End Developer Itasca, Illinois Consulting, Operations 20007703 Get Referred Get Job AlertsJob DescriptionAccertify Inc. a wholly owned subsidiary of American Express, is a leader in providing software, tools and strategies for preventing online fraud and mitigating enterprise-wide risks. Accertify is committed to providing e-commerce companies with comprehensive and cost-effective solutions to fraud. Accertifys development team is looking for a skilled software engineer. This individual will use their software development background and strong analytical skills to help build and enhance Accertifys industry-leading tools. This individuals day-to-day work will involve using Java, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, SQL, Linux, git and gradle to design and build software solutions that are fast, scalable and flexible. As a part of the team, you will:Work with business representatives, Lead Developers, and the Director of Software Development to design, build and test new products and featuresUse the IDE of your choice to write code in Java, Javascript, HTML and cssParticipate in the development and testing of internal tools, scripts and other coding projectsWork independently or on small team projectsParticipate in peer code reviewsTroubleshoot and optimize code for usability, performance, and scalabilityWe seek individuals with strong fundamental programming experience, great communication skills, and a love for working on challenging problems.Minimum QualificationsRequired Skills/Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in Computer ScienceVery strong and demonstrable analytical, problem solving, and debugging skillsProfessional programming experience in an enterprise setting2+ years software development experience as a Java developerKnowledge of the basic Web technologies: HTML, CSS, JavascriptFamiliarity with basic programming constructs (conditionals, loops, data structures)Experience in Linux OS and command line operationsStrong Relational database skills (SQL, JDBC - Oracle and PostgreSQL preferred)Working knowledge of industry standard formats, especially XML, CSV, and JSON; this includes understanding of character encodings like UTF-8 and ISO-Latin 1Desired Skills:Experience with Python or GroovyEmployment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions. American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.ReqID: 20007703Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-timeDate Posted: Oct 28, 2020, 4:39:59 PMEEO StatementAmerican Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.ApplyShare JobContact UsManage Your ProfileManage Your Profile (Students)Employeeslinkedin social media icon facebook social media icon twitter social media icon youtube social media icon instagram social media iconAll users of our online services subject to both Privacy Statement and Terms of Service.AdChoicesPrivacy StatementTerms of ServiceAmerican Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.US Candidates/Employees: Click here to view the EEO is the Law poster and supplement and the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.US Job Seekers: If you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation in order to apply for a positionyou may contact us by clicking here or call our US Toll-free number at 1-855-297-7327. 2020 American Express Company. This individuals day-to-day work will involve using Java, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, SQL, Linux, git and gradle to design and build software solutions that are fast, scalable and flexible. As a part of the team, you will:Work with business representatives, Lead Developers, and the Director of Software Development to design, build and test new products and featuresUse the IDE of your choice to write code in Java, Javascript, HTML and cssParticipate in the development and testing of internal tools, scripts and other coding projectsWork independently or on small team projectsParticipate in peer code reviewsTroubleshoot and optimize code for usability, performance, and scalabilityWe seek individuals with strong fundamental programming experience, great communication skills, and a love for working on challenging problems.Minimum QualificationsRequired Skills/Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in Computer ScienceVery strong and demonstrable analytical, problem solving, and debugging skillsProfessional programming experience in an enterprise setting2+ years software development experience as a Java developerKnowledge of the basic Web technologies: HTML, CSS, JavascriptFamiliarity with basic programming constructs (conditionals, loops, data structures)Experience in Linux OS and command line operationsStrong Relational database skills (SQL, JDBC - Oracle and PostgreSQL preferred)Working knowledge of industry standard formats, especially XML, CSV, and JSON; this includes understanding of character encodings like UTF-8 and ISO-Latin 1Desired Skills:Experience with Python or GroovyEmployment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions. American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.ReqID: 20007703Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-timeDate Posted: Oct 28, 2020, 4:39:59 PMEEO StatementAmerican Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.ApplyShare JobContact UsManage Your ProfileManage Your Profile (Students)Employeeslinkedin social media icon facebook social media icon twitter social media icon youtube social media icon instagram social media iconAll users of our online services subject to both Privacy Statement and Terms of Service.AdChoicesPrivacy StatementTerms of ServiceAmerican Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.US Candidates/Employees: Click here to view the EEO is the Law poster and supplement and the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.US Job Seekers: If you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation in order to apply for a positionyou may contact us by clicking here or call our US Toll-free number at 1-855-297-7327. 2020 American Express Company. This includes providing technology to support video interviews, resources and support for employees to work from home successfully, and fully covered healthcare for eligible employees.  Our Aquent Software Development Center is looking for a Front End Developer to join the team. This is a LONG TERM opportunity with great benefits!  (W2 Only, No C2C) Aquent IT Solutions: Where Vision Becomes RealityDo you know JavaScript, React/Redux, single page application? Are you interested in working with a group of fun people who are rooted in design and building web apps for Fortune 100 companies? If so, then this may be the role for you!We are looking for a Front-End Web Developer who understands UX design, with 2-3 years of exp with good exposure to React/Redux/TDD/ Internationalization, and can craft visual components using advanced front-end technologies.What You'll DoThis position requires a problem-solver with solid experience in web technologies, browsers, and user interface principles, including:Duties/Responsibilities:Working as bridge between UX Design and Application implementation with heavy React/Redux/TDD functions without excessive supervisionWorking along with enterprise Front-End architectsUnderstanding concepts such as mobile first, responsive designRefactoring of complex features to help improve their structure and maintainabilityPractice and experience Test Driven Development (TDD) and Unit Test frameworksEnsuring code quality and application performancePeer code reviewsWorking with Agile team members and stakeholders. Story grooming and relative estimation with teamWorking as a team player focusing on reuse, performance, standards and delivery timelineAnchor technical discussion, lead team of developers towards successful solution implementationExcellent communication and documentation skillsWhats RequiredExperience with the following skills is required:JavaScript (expert level)2-3 years of exp with good exposure to React/Redux/TDDjQueryNode.jsHTML5, CSS3GITReact/Redux/Hooks or AngularDesign patternsSwagger.io Note: We understand that Java development is more like an art of development and implementation, number of years in the experience is important but we are ready to talk to you even if you are new to this field but have strong expertise of required skills rooted within you. Familiarity with one or more is desirable:REST, Web services / microservice architectureGIT, Jenkins, Maven, CICloud development AWS or Azure and infrastructure as codeAngularJavaDatabasesSecurity implementation using OKTA **( W2 Only- No C2C, Must be On-site at Work Location) Required: You will be required to complete a coding test assessment.Client Description:Why Aquent IT SolutionsAquent IT Solutions operates a mission-critical application development center and consulting firm headquartered in East Moline, IL in the Quad Cities (QC). We offer challenging opportunities in front-end and back-end web application development, UX design, project management, business analysis, business intelligence, big data, and more. We have an engaging work environment, a diverse and comfortable community of affordable living, minimal commuting, quality education, and great entertainment. As a credit to our philosophy, many Aquent IT Solutions employees are in their second decade of employment with our company.SHARE: Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Share to LinkedInAPPLY NOWLOGIN FIND WORKFIND OUT WHO WE AREFrom the beginning, weve believed that change doesnt happen without leadership. You will be contributing to our client's success by authoring, scheduling, and launching content on their website using their CMS and related tools. The ideal candidate should have a working knowledge of web content management and publishing systems and familiarity with CMS workflows, ecommerce site architecture and folder structures, HTML, CSS and related libraries (Bootstrap), JavaScript and related libraries (JQuery, Riot, etc).The web producer executes the creation and maintenance of the HTML, CSS and JavaScript for existing pages, new projects and emerging programs through a content management and publishing tool. This person will need to deliver projects on time, which adhere to project requirements with standards compliant code. The ideal candidate for this position has a strong business acumen, excellent oral and written communication and the ability to use critical thinking skills to proactively problem-solve, mitigate business risk and assure deliverables meet project timelines.RESPONSIBILITIES:Support execution of Site Production projects by adding assets, setting template configurations and publishing content using CMS and other publishing tools  Some advanced CMS authoring scenarios (custom HTML, CSS, JS)Code HTML banners for use on search pages (top banners, spot 6s, bottom banners)Write custom HTML snippets for placements that cant be authored using existing widgetsParticipate in Site Production projects from beginning to end, including project kickoff, reviews, technical execution and post launch supportTranslate creative mockups/wireframes in order to author digital experiences based on design specs and template/technical markup compliance.Work closely with interactive designer and copywriter to ensure their layouts are being translated as expected.Identify opportunities to enhance templates based on recognition of unmet business and creative requirementsCoordinate website launch support for new content and promotional launchesHandle a high volume of concurrent projects, while maintaining transparency with task/project status reportingPerform quality assurance review fields.description: Frontend Software Engineerat ArmoryUSA, Canada, Mexico, RemoteDo you want to work with people who love what they do while building a product that has real impact?We're looking for passionate, product-focused frontend software engineers who have hacked systems in creative ways, who are curious about new languages, technologies, and trends.We believe that working hard is a byproduct of loving what you do and not something that can be measured on a timesheet.At Armory, you'll work in small, collaborative, agile teams, interface directly with customers, and build awesome products that address real problems. There are no facts in the building; everyone owns their own mistakes; we ship code continuously; we are a crew.Do you have experience with some or most of the below? We'd love to talk! 3+ years experienceDeep domain expertise in JavaScript, HTML, CSSReactTypescriptRestful APIsStrong communication skills, able to communicate complex technical ideas to anyone, able to collaborate effectively with designers Skills or experience in the following are a strong plus:Cloud platformsDocker or other container technologySpinnaker Our current front end tech stack is TypeScript and React, backed by JVM based web-services (mostly Java and Kotlin, some groovy), Go, Python, Kubernetes, SpringMVC, AWS and, of course, a strong focus on dog fooding our own continuous delivery tools. You don't have to know our exact tech stack, but you should be familiar with similar tools and willing to learn. At Armory, our concept of diversity is broad. We understand that diversity comes in many forms and includes age, socioeconomic status, educational background, ethnic identity and national origin, marital and familial status, gender expression and identity, transgender status, disability status, religious affiliation, sex and sexual orientation, veteran status, neurodivergence, and mental health status. As we build a company that is both diverse and inclusive, we are also working on the way we communicate. There are challenges, stumbling blocks, and failings, but we are committed to learning and improving to make Armory a welcoming company.This is a blog post from Armorys CEO sharing his perspective of being an accomplice and not just an ally: https://drodio.com/be-a-diversity-and-inclusion-accomplice-not-just-ally/ Armory is a Series C startup backed by B-Capital, Insight, Crosslink Capital, Y Combinator (W17), Bain Capital, and Javelin Venture Partners based in San Mateo, CA. We believe software is the highest leverage way to improve humanity. So, we are building a platform that unlocks collaboration between your Dev, Sec, and Ops teams and tools, from Code to Cloud. Built on Spinnaker, our Policy-Driven Deployments enable you to innovate with speed & safety. Our platform automates software delivery to make engineers happy and productive. Apply for this Job* RequiredFirst Name *Last Name *Email *Phone *Resume/CVAttach Dropbox PasteLinkedIn ProfileGitHub ProfileNo file chosen

fields.description: PROFILEJOBSMORESEARCHMacallan Savett avatarAvatar for Mental Health MatchMental Health MatchAn online marketplace for therapists and counselorsShareFollowOverviewPeopleCultureFundingJobs1Software Engineer (Backend/Node.js) for Growing Health Startup (remote / US-based)$95k  $140k AngelList Est.Apply nowMental Health Match is fast-growing marketplace that simplifies the search for mental health care. Our unique platform and matching algorithm instantly match people to the therapists and counselors who best meet their needs, including budget/insurance, cultural fit, and expertise.We are a mission-driven social enterprise with proven traction. Launched last year, over 1,000 therapists have joined the platform, and we have matched over 25,000 people to the mental health professionals who can best help them.This backend role will work closely with our CTO to build, architect, and deploy new systems to fuel our next phase of our growth. They will work closely with our full team to make decisions about the product and help create a foundation to grow our technical team. The ideal candidate will be excited about getting a full 360 degree view of the product, market, and business they are a part of.Your primary duties:Your primary duties will involve the full range of development, deployment, and data management of a Node.js backend application.You will also support infrastructure projects including implementing CI, improving automated testing, and preparing data for consumption by various machine learning methods.*These responsibilities include: *Help architect, build, and maintain our back-end API using Nodejs, JavaScript, Postgres, and various third-party integrations, including collaboration in database design.Implement and maintain test suitesCollaborate on data architecture, product strategy and feature development, including adoption of new technologies.Assist with managing, supporting and troubleshooting the infrastructure required to run these projects and ancillary technologies.Help build and improve a robust set of systems and technologies required to run a startup with a small team.Qualifications:Node.js (3+ years, full-time work experience)Javascript (3+years full-time work experienceRelational Databases: (3+ years full-time work experience)This is a fully-remote position available to only permanent residents of the US (citizens or green card holders) who are currently living in the US. We cannot offer sponsorships such as H-1Bs.CompensationThis is a full-time position. Compensation is a competitive salary plus equity options, subsidized health, dental, and vision insurance, and up to 5 weeks of annual vacation. We have a flexible work culture that supports the wellbeing of our employees and healthy work-life balance.To apply:Please send a resume and links to relevant projects you are proud of to: hiring@mentalhealthmatch.com.Apply nowLocationPortland  RemoteHires remotely inUnited StatesJob typeFull-timeVisa sponsorshipNot AvailableExperience3+ yearsSkillsJavascriptNode.jsRelational DatabasesHiring contactRyan SchwartzFounderAvatar for Ryan SchwartzJobsABOUT MENTAL HEALTH MATCHWebsitementalhealthmatch.comLocationsPortlandRemoteCompany size1-10 peopleMarketsHealthcareAdvertising PlatformsHealth and WellnessMental HealthJOBS AT MENTAL HEALTH MATCHEngineering1 jobJOBS YOU MIGHT LIKELead Front End DeveloperTelzioLos Angeles  Remote$140k  $160k  0.0%  1.0%Avatar for TelzioFull Stack Developer - fields.description: PROFILEJOBSMORESEARCHMacallan Savett avatarAvatar for Privacy.comPrivacy.comGenerate a new virtual card for every purchaseShareFollowOverviewPeopleCultureFundingJobs7Software Engineer$100k  $160k  0.01%  0.3%Apply nowAbout UsWe're reimagining the way people and businesses spend money online using ephemeral card numbers.We're a close-knit (32-person), rapidly growing company backed by top tier investors looking to expand our engineering team to keep pace with our growth. We believe that there is an enormous opportunity to improve the lives of millions of people by building financial tools that are both safe and delightful to use.As an early member of the team, you will make a significant impact on both the product and culture. You'll have the chance to work on a multitude of interesting challenges across card processing, API architecture, fraud and abuse detection, scaling, and new product development.About the roleAs a software engineer at Privacy, you should be just as comfortable working with Javascript callbacks as you are with multiprocessing in python, as well as wearing the occasional DevOps hat. Depending on your interests, you'll have the opportunity to work on a variety of areas and languages, including:Improving our fraud modeling and ML classifiers that detect anomalous behavior and prevent fraudUpdates to our real-time transaction processing engine with millisecond response timesNew features for both the hundreds of thousands of consumers using our product and the hundreds of businesses using our APIBuilding out growth hooks, A/B testing and supporting growth and retention effortsWhat we're looking for2+ years of experience shipping code in a production environmentProficiency in at least one language - we work in Javascript / Python / C++ / Java / SQL, but care much more general engineering skill than knowledge of a particular language or framework.An understanding of the balance between perfection and shipping quicklyAwareness that code is written as much for humans to read and maintain as it is for machines to interpretOwnership of the features from start to finishUnderstanding of algorithms, systems, and designWhy apply?In addition to competitive salary and equity we offer the following:Flexible vacation policy; take time when you need itRemote friendlyPaid parental leave401(k) with employer contributionMedical / dental / vision coverage3% cashback on all purchases with PrivacyChoose your own Apple equipmentCommuter benefitsConveniently located office in lower Manhattan near many trainsPrivacy is an equal opportunity employer. Were committed to ensuring a safe and inclusive workplace by welcoming people of all backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We encourage people from traditionally underrepresented groups to apply. If you have a disability or other need that requires accommodations in the application process, please let us know.Apply nowLocationNew York City  RemoteHires remotelyEverywhereJob typeFull-timeVisa sponsorshipNot AvailableExperience2+ yearsHiring contactJason KruseCTO - we're hiring across the stack. fields.description: Software Engineer$90k  $100k  0.02%  0.05%Apply nowAbout Mighty:Mighty is on a mission to help millions of injured plaintiffs get a better deal from the civil justice system. Today, our ownership management platform helps personal injury law firms, medical providers and financial service businesses manage their personal injury liens in more than 150,000 cases worth over $1 Billion. We are growing our team with the support of a $9M Series A led by IA Ventures and Tribeca Venture Partners in March 2018.Mighty is looking for a self-starting engineer who has passion for leveraging technology to solve social problems. The ideal candidate possesses outstanding intellectual horsepower and loves the autonomy of owning projects. Youre the kind of person who enjoys getting their hands dirty, isnt afraid to ask questions, is eager to learn and wants to contribute technical solutions to big hairy problems. The role can be based out of the NYC office or fully remote, if thats the preference of the hire.Responsibilities:Contribute to our code base and ensure our coding standards are maintained through quality code reviewsCollaborate cross-functionally with Product, and Growth teamsAssist with ongoing software development initiatives and learn about our architecture, industry and use baseRequirements:3+ years of prior engineering experienceFluency in at least one of these languages: Python, Typescript, JavascriptExperience with OOP and exposure to FPExperience building RESTful APIsExperience with relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, etc)Comfort getting around a Linux-based cloud infrastructureExposure to DockerFamiliarity with a framework with Django, Rails, or a similar web frameworkBenefits:Competitive compensationFull Benefits - health, vision, and dental, 401(k) with company contributionUnlimited paid time off - take time when you need itMonthly lunch stipendStipend for home office furniture and accessoriesLearning and Development opportunitiesAnd more!

fields.description: PROFILEJOBSMORESEARCHMacallan Savett avatarAvatar for PuzzlePuzzleReimagining core financial infrastructure for greater trust, speed and accuracyShareUnfollowOverviewPeopleCultureFundingJobs2Software Engineer$120k  $175k  0.5%  0.65%Apply nowOur goal is to improve company outcomes & value for customers, employees, and shareholders. Starting a company has become easier, but growing a company is just as hard. We are bringing the best advice from venture capitalists, successful entrepreneurs, and CFOs to the fingertips of startups to help them grow from formation to IPO.Puzzle is a young startup that is looking to fill out their first key engineering positions. This is an opportunity to help drive architecture, process and culture. We value technical ability, collaboration, and humility. We move fast and are driven to meet our goals.Our founder built one of the largest YC companies that scaled from two people to hundreds, no customers to millions, raised over $500MM and wants to build something bigger. He had a nearly perfect rating on Glassdoor, building a high performance, low ego, diverse team.You are self motivated and entrepreneurial. You can find answers on your own, but know when to ask for help. You are driven and passionate, and want to create a product our users love. And you love numbers over opinions (when you have them!).We use TypeScript, Node, PostGres, Python, GraphQL, and React all on GCP - maybe that will change. You can be given a fuzzy feature - help define it and get it done. You aren't afraid to touch any part of our system. Its early now - but we have a lot of interesting technology we need to build to get where we are going. We are small so youll get into some devops - but we strive for devops-0 - so we take advantage of services and automation so we can concentrate on building value, not reinventing the wheel.This is your opportunity to be an early engineer at a well funded startup that has a successful founder, a drive to build a world class team, and an attractive equity package. We have room for senior folks with strong backgrounds to juniors that have drive and a will to learn.We are going to win - and well have fun along the way!Apply nowLocationSan Francisco  RemoteHires remotely inCanada  United StatesJob typeFull-timeVisa sponsorshipNot AvailableExperience2+ yearsSkillsPythonCloud ComputingPostgreSQLFinancial ServicesETLTypeScriptData PipelinesGraphQL/ApolloHiring contactJohn CwiklaCTO  11 monthsAvatar for John CwiklaMore jobs at PuzzleView all jobsBackend EngineerSan Francisco  Remote$100k  $175k  0.1%  0.65%Apply nowJobsABOUT PUZZLEWebsitepuzzle.ioLocationRemoteCompany size1-10 peopleMarketsSaaSFinance TechnologyJOBS AT PUZZLEEngineering2 jobsJOBS YOU MIGHT LIKELead Front End DeveloperTelzioLos Angeles  Remote$140k  $160k  0.0%  1.0%Avatar for TelzioFull Stack Developer - fields.description: PROFILEJOBSMORESEARCHMacallan Savett avatarAvatar for PuzzlePuzzleReimagining core financial infrastructure for greater trust, speed and accuracyShareUnfollowOverviewPeopleCultureFundingJobs2Backend Engineer$100k  $175k  0.1%  0.65%Apply nowStealth(y) mode startup. Starting a company has become easier, but growing a company is more complicated than ever. We are rethinking the core financial infrastructure to improve company outcomes & increase value for customers, employees, and shareholders. We are bringing the best advice from venture capitalists, successful entrepreneurs, and CFOs to the fingertips of startups to help them grow from formation to IPO.We will start by helping startups improve their financial performance, which determines a companys ability to raise venture capital, at what valuation, which attracts great talent to the company and ultimately drives employee and investor returns.Puzzle is a young startup that is looking to fill out their first key engineering positions. This is an opportunity to help drive architecture, process and culture. We value technical ability, collaboration, and humility. We move fast and are driven to meet our goals.Our founder built one of the largest YC companies that scaled from two people to hundreds, no customers to millions, raised over $500MM and wants to build something bigger. He had a nearly perfect rating on Glassdoor, building a high performance, low ego, diverse team.You are self motivated and entrepreneurial. You can find answers on your own, but know when to ask for help. You are driven and passionate, and want to create a product our users love. And you love numbers over opinions (when you have them!).As our Backend Engineer you will help design and build our financial data system. We will be ingesting large amounts of data from disparate sources, correlating them, transforming them, and producing the core system for the rest of our products. We expect the data to be large, dirty, and difficult to wrangle. We want to be as real time as possible, event driven, and decoupled. Redundant and resistant. And accuracy is key.But thats half the fun. The other half is understanding how we can correlate that data to our financial models and building an efficient, scalable and provably correct system. Wed love to hear how your background and skills can be applied to our product.This is your opportunity to be an early engineer at a well funded startup that has a successful founder, a drive to build a world class team, and an attractive equity package.We are going to win - and well have fun along the way!Apply nowLocationSan Francisco  RemoteHires remotely inCanada  United StatesJob typeFull-timeVisa sponsorshipNot AvailableExperience2+ yearsSkillsFinancial ServicesData WarehouseEvent Driven ArchitectureAlgorithms & Data StructuresGrowth and Scale-upHiring contactJohn CwiklaCTO  11 monthsAvatar for John CwiklaMore jobs at PuzzleView all jobsSoftware EngineerSan Francisco  Remote$120k  $175k  0.5%  0.65%Apply nowJobsABOUT PUZZLEWebsitepuzzle.ioLocationRemoteCompany size1-10 peopleMarketsSaaSFinance TechnologyJOBS AT PUZZLEEngineering2 jobsJOBS YOU MIGHT LIKELead Front End DeveloperTelzioLos Angeles  Remote$140k  $160k  0.0%  1.0%Avatar for TelzioFull Stack Developer - fields.description: PROFILEJOBSMORESEARCHMacallan Savett avatarAvatar for UnderUnderFinTech platform automating the application and customer onboarding process while mitigating riskShareFollowOverviewPeopleCultureFundingJobs1Backend Software Engineer$80k  $100k  0.01%  0.5%Apply nowUnder is looking for a backend software engineer to help develop our REST API infrastructure and supporting microservices. Under is built using AWS Cloud services on a serverless architecture. Our team is implementing a data engineering pipeline and comprehensive data model that integrates with dozens of third parties within the processing, banking, and FinTech space. If you have cut your teeth for the last few years on a bigger team and you are looking to venture out, start playing a bigger role, and solving more complex problems then you could be a great addition to our team.Day-to-Day ResponsibilitiesBuilding out our core product on the AWS Cloud services and serverless architecture (Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB)Creating microservices connecting with a host of third-party APIsHelp define and evolve our data modelCollaborating with founders and off-site team to shape the product roadmapAssist with operational support to triage potential production issues and support client requirementsContinuous learning by keeping current with industry technology trends to help guide software roadmapTroubleshooting issues and general problem solvingMinimum QualificationsBachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field2+ years Javascript software development experience in a professional work environment, with an emphasis on Node.jsExperience developing and integrating with RESTful APIsExperience building new microservices to support functional requirements, core intellectual property advancementsExperience implementing infrastructure as code approaches and configuring CI/CD pipelinesExperience working with third-party dependencies and debugging dependency conflictsPreferred QualificationsAn entrepreneurial spirit and passionate about technologyComfortable at an early stage startupWork with React.js,, AWS Services including API Gateway, Lambda, Cloudwatch, and S3Able to articulate solutions via technical documentation for other team membersPerform operational checks for the production environmentCollaborate with a supportive and agile virtual team to deliver pragmatic software solutionsBenefitsHealth Insurance (Medical, Dental, and Vision)Stock OptionsFlexible HoursWork-from-homeEducation StipendAbout UnderUnder is a financial technology (FinTech) Software as a Service company founded in late 2019 and located in Chicago, Illinois. We believe that the current onboarding process at financial institutions is antiquated and ripe for innovation. Our vision is to develop a federated identity management system that stores and validates persistent personal and business data. In the future, forms and applications will be eradicated and replaced with a simple validation form authored by the team at Under.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Apply nowLocationChicago  RemoteHires remotely inUnited StatesJob typeFull-timeVisa sponsorshipNot AvailableExperience2+ yearsSkillsNode.jsREST APIsAWS Cloud ServicesMicroservicesHiring contactMichael AbramovicFounderAvatar for Michael AbramovicMeet your teamPeople you would work with in this roleJeff SheaFounderAvatar for Jeff SheaFounder @Payline DataFollowAvatar for John SunAvatar for Jason BrownAvatar for Ryan Jones31 followersMichael AbramovicFounderAvatar for Michael AbramovicCo-Founder @UnderFollowAvatar for Chris TataAvatar for Bryan NeubergAvatar for Breeze Curran40 followersCultureView all photos and perksHealthcareMedical, Dental, and VisionStock optionsOwn a piece of the company you are helping buildWork-from-homeWFHProfessional developmentStipend provided to continue learningJobsABOUT UNDERWebsiteundereverything.comLocationChicagoCompany size1-10 peopleTotal raised$400KMarketsMobileSaaSData SecurityRisk ManagementFin TechJOBS AT UNDEREngineering1 jobJOBS YOU MIGHT LIKELead Front End DeveloperTelzioLos Angeles  Remote$140k  $160k  0.0%  1.0%Avatar for TelzioFull Stack Developer - fields.description: PROFILEJOBSMORESEARCHMacallan Savett avatarAvatar for WelcomeWelcomeA high end, branded virtual event platformShareFollowOverviewPeopleCultureFundingJobs13Software Engineer, Full Stack$120k  $180k  0.1%  0.4%Apply nowWelcome is a virtual event platform for high-end, branded events. Using Welcome, a single person can create a jaw-dropping experience that feels like an Apple product launch. We've built the first five-star virtual event venue and have the product and services to match. Our flagship product allows our customers to create an event that feels like an interactive TV show. There is nothing else like it.Were well-funded by top VCs. Within three months of a soft launch weve already signed a Fortune 500 company and the worlds largest investment fund. Over the next few years, we project that we will be the number one player in the space with massive market share, resulting in huge revenue and valuation.This is an incredible opportunity for the right person to have a massive impact on Welcomes business. We are growing insanely fast and looking for a strong full-stack software engineer to join our world-class team, match the tsunami of demand we are already experiencing, and help us grow even faster.You want your code to have significant and measurable positive impact. You love bringing people together. Your happiness comes from the joy of others, and you look forward to building stand-out moments of delight into the Welcome experience. You are a keen problem solver and team player. You take pride in the craftsmanship of your work, and appreciate when it is rewarded; our customers are fine with fewer features, but are not okay with broken features. The software engineer role at Welcome encompasses architecture, design, implementation, and testing to ensure we build and release products in a way that upholds the luxury quality of our brand.ResponsibilitiesBe part of an inclusive, collaborative team that embraces healthy discussions and supports each other in their goalsArchitect, design, implement, test, and deliver robust and delightful products, continuing to keep the Welcome experience best-in-class.Master our development process, culture, and code base, then improve it. Continually leave each of these in a better state than when you found itBasic Requirements3+ years of professional software development experienceDeep experience with at least one object oriented programming language (Java, Javascript, C++, C#, Ruby, Python, et al.) and corresponding web framework (Spring, Express, Rails, Django, et al.). Our backend is built in Ruby on RailsSolid understanding of web technologies, such as JavaScript, CSS, HTML5, and JSON. Our frontend is built in React.js and ReduxSolid understanding of SQL databases and relational database schema designExcellent written and verbal communication skillsPreferred RequirementsExperience building with WebRTC or other audio/video technologiesExperience building highly concurrent and scalable web applications, understanding of performance from the browser/DOM to the databaseTrack record of being a top performer in current and past rolesOur Investments in YouCompetitive salary and equity compensationGreat medical, dental, and vision insurance optionsFitness, cell phone, and internet reimbursementsTop-of-the-line work computer$2,000 budget to build your dream home officeOpportunities to attend the most high-end virtual events in the world**PLEASE NOTE: We unable to sponsor visas or offer relocation assistance at this time. We are also only able to hire US based candidates.Welcome embraces diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As part of our commitment to diversifying our workforce, we do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, sex, gender, gender identity, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, marital status, citizenship, veteran status, or disability status.We are composed of a diverse group of entrepreneurs, dreamers and builders who believe that exceptional, high-quality experiences can seamlessly bring people together, invite collaboration, and provide a meaningful sense of belonging. If you align to these principles and have what it takes wed love to hear from you.Apply nowLocationUnited States  RemoteHires remotelyEverywhereJob typeFull-timeVisa sponsorshipAvailableHiring contactJerry ShenFounderAvatar for Jerry ShenMore jobs at WelcomeView all jobsSoftware Engineer, Mobile (React Native, iOS, Android)United States  Remote$100k  $180kApply nowSite Reliability EngineerUnited States  Remote$100k  $140k AngelList Est.Apply nowSoftware Engineer, Audio/VideoUnited States  Remote$125k  $195k AngelList Est.Apply nowSoftware Engineer, BackendUnited States  Remote$95k  $140k AngelList Est.Apply nowSoftware Engineer, FrontendUnited States  Remote$85k  $125k AngelList Est.Apply nowSoftware Engineer, ProductUnited States  Remote$125k  $195k AngelList Est.Apply nowJobsABOUT WELCOMEWebsiteexperiencewelcome.comLocationSan FranciscoCompany size1-10 peopleMarketEventsJOBS AT WELCOMEEngineering7 jobsOperations1 jobSales5 jobsJOBS YOU MIGHT LIKELead Front End DeveloperTelzioLos Angeles  Remote$140k  $160k  0.0%  1.0%Avatar for TelzioFull Stack Developer - You love bringing people together. Your happiness comes from the joy of others, and you look forward to building stand-out moments of delight into the Welcome experience. You are a keen problem solver and team player. You take pride in the craftsmanship of your work, and appreciate when it is rewarded; our customers are fine with fewer features, but are not okay with broken features. The software engineer role at Welcome encompasses architecture, design, implementation, and testing to ensure we build and release products in a way that upholds the luxury quality of our brand.ResponsibilitiesBe part of an inclusive, collaborative team that embraces healthy discussions and supports each other in their goalsArchitect, design, implement, test, and deliver robust and delightful products, continuing to keep the Welcome experience best-in-class.Master our development process, culture, and code base, then improve it. Continually leave each of these in a better state than when you found itBasic Requirements3+ years of professional software development experienceDeep experience with at least one object oriented programming language (Java, Javascript, C++, C#, Ruby, Python, et al.) and corresponding web framework (Spring, Express, Rails, Django, et al.). Our backend is built in Ruby on RailsSolid understanding of web technologies, such as JavaScript, CSS, HTML5, and JSON. Our frontend is built in React.js and ReduxSolid understanding of SQL databases and relational database schema designExcellent written and verbal communication skillsPreferred RequirementsExperience building with WebRTC or other audio/video technologiesExperience building highly concurrent and scalable web applications, understanding of performance from the browser/DOM to the databaseTrack record of being a top performer in current and past rolesOur Investments in YouCompetitive salary and equity compensationGreat medical, dental, and vision insurance optionsFitness, cell phone, and internet reimbursementsTop-of-the-line work computer$2,000 budget to build your dream home officeOpportunities to attend the most high-end virtual events in the world**PLEASE NOTE: We unable to sponsor visas or offer relocation assistance at this time. We are also only able to hire US based candidates.Welcome embraces diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As part of our commitment to diversifying our workforce, we do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, sex, gender, gender identity, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, marital status, citizenship, veteran status, or disability status.We are composed of a diverse group of entrepreneurs, dreamers and builders who believe that exceptional, high-quality experiences can seamlessly bring people together, invite collaboration, and provide a meaningful sense of belonging. If you align to these principles and have what it takes wed love to hear from you.Apply nowLocationUnited States  RemoteHires remotelyEverywhereJob typeFull-timeVisa sponsorshipAvailableHiring contactJerry ShenFounderAvatar for Jerry ShenMore jobs at WelcomeView all jobsSoftware Engineer, Mobile (React Native, iOS, Android)United States  Remote$100k  $180kApply nowSite Reliability EngineerUnited States  Remote$100k  $140k AngelList Est.Apply nowSoftware Engineer, Audio/VideoUnited States  Remote$125k  $195k AngelList Est.Apply nowSoftware Engineer, BackendUnited States  Remote$95k  $140k AngelList Est.Apply nowSoftware Engineer, FrontendUnited States  Remote$85k  $125k AngelList Est.Apply nowSoftware Engineer, ProductUnited States  Remote$125k  $195k AngelList Est.Apply nowJobsABOUT WELCOMEWebsiteexperiencewelcome.comLocationSan FranciscoCompany size1-10 peopleMarketEventsJOBS AT WELCOMEEngineering7 jobsOperations1 jobSales5 jobsJOBS YOU MIGHT LIKELead Front End DeveloperTelzioLos Angeles  Remote$140k  $160k  0.0%  1.0%Avatar for TelzioFull Stack Developer - fields.description: PROFILEJOBSMORESEARCHMacallan Savett avatarAvatar for Triple Point LiquidityTriple Point LiquidityTransact Private & Illiquid AssetsShareFollowOverviewPeopleCultureFundingJobs2Backend Engineer$100k  $150k  0.0%  1.0%Apply nowTriple Point Liquidity builds the worlds most advanced platform for complex private equity transactions. Headquartered in New York City, the Triple Point Liquidity platform connects fund administrators, general partners, broker-dealers, and limited partners.We use a private, permissioned blockchain to facilitate and ledger the transaction of private and illiquid assets. The platform enhances shareholder registrar and transfer agency services, and serves to facilitate secondary market liquidity by leveraging and connecting into an ecosystem of sophisticated financial counterparties.Our team spans a wealth of knowledge from finance and fintech, pharma, security, data, and more. Wed love to work with someone who expands how we think while helping us stay lean. Its a special time to join the team, and we hope you will.Engineering Team:Triple Point is looking to bring on several new full-time hires interested in engineering something of real service and value. We release lean, resilient code that will last through the next stage of growth. Were seeking confident and motivated people that see and hear their teammates. People that want to ship code they can be proud of and are looking for a great technical culture to refine their game. Its a rowing team, not a football team.Our technology stack is composed of fullstack node with typescript, react, hyperledger fabric blockchain, kubernetes, helm, mongo. We operate across a multi-cloud infrastructure; expect to become familiar with AWS and IBM Cloud.We operate onsite in NYC but are open to fully-remote candidates, especially in the wake of the COVID pandemic. We operate onsite in NYC but are open to fully-remote candidates, especially in the wake of the COVID pandemic.Backend Engineer:The backend engineering position will analyze, plan, and develop systems, including API, data model, state machine, blockchain, auth and permissions, and infrastructure. We have some great people on the team already, and while you wont be alone you will be expected to get up to speed and take initiative. This role is open to very senior staff, or someone who has recently started; were focused on your mastery of the skills. Our expectation is that you are low-ego, a lifelong learner, and committed to the craft.Requirements:Wed like to talk with you about the following. Depending on your level of experience, well look for you to know:Statically typed language: we use TypeScript but experience with languages like Java or C# is welcomeData modeling: you have integrated data from an external API or data store in an existing systemRDBMS and NoSQL: you know the tradeoffs and can choose appropriately for a given use caseExperience with cloud-hosted infrastructureComfortable with UNIX shell: comfortable with basics such as jobs and userland tools like cut or grepExperience with Docker or other containerization solutionVersion control: any of Git, TFS, HgYou understand how to write a correct unit test.DebuggingLike to collaborate: communicate well with your teammates with a commitment to good technical docs and specs.Team estimation and grooming: understands the value of work prep.Nice to Have:Hyperledger or other Blockchain experiencecontainer orchestration: you are familiar with one of Kubernetes, ECS, MesosExperience with a functional programming language like Scala or ClojureDeclarative infrastructure: familiar with Terraform or CloudFormation,Advanced cloud infrastructure: HA, messaging, CDNs, shardingExperience working on a system with multi-tenancyCI/CD pipeline: Youve written or maintained a deploy strategy with automated testingData engineering or ETLDocument systems.Security or compliance.Fresh perspectives that support both product and engineering needs.Accepted non-trivial PR on a FOSS project.Work in the financial industryBenefitsSolid healthcare plansRemote work / distributed team environment401kFamily, parenthood, and related allowancesSafe and friendly work cultureTriple Point Liquidity is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. And we mean this, its not boilerplate. Triple Point Liquidity also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.Apply nowLocationNew York City  RemoteHires remotely inUnited StatesJob typeFull-timeVisa sponsorshipNot AvailableExperience1+ yearsSkillsNode.jsDatabase and Systems DesignArchitectREST APIsTypeScriptBlockchainHiring contactZacharyVP Engineering  7 monthsAvatar for ZacharyMeet your teamPeople you would work with in this roleJared E KleePresidentAvatar for Jared E KleePresident, Triple Point Liquidity (Lots more info on LinkedIn)FollowAvatar for Richard McSharryAvatar for Michael SinghurseAvatar for Mallory LeeWong4 followersZacharyVP Engineering  7 monthsAvatar for ZacharyBusiness, product, and people strategy with deep engagement and data models. fields.description: Skip to main contentUber CareersJob searchSearch JobsSr Software Engineer (Frontend/Full Stack) - VehiclesEngineering in Seattle, WashingtonApply NowAbout the RoleThe Vehicles team's core mission is to fuel Uber's growth by unlocking sustainable access to vehicles for our Earners world-wide through a vibrant and prosperous Supplier community. The team builds B2B mobile, web and API based products that empower Vehicle Suppliers such as fleets, taxis, rental companies and car manufacturers to onboard, handle, optimize and scale their businesses on Uber's mobility platform. Our products are used by hundreds of thousands of suppliers across the globe with a high expectation of feature richness, ease of use and reliability.As an Engineer on this team, you will have the ability to build and ship features from scratch across our Fleet Management, Vehicle Marketplace, and Payments products and positively impact the businesses of our Vehicle Suppliers.What You'll DoDesign, implement, test and rollout new features across Vehicles team's web propertiesImprove the reliability and engineering quality of existing services or featuresWork in close collaboration with other engineers, product managers, designers and operations to ship useful and delightful experiences to our customersContribute to building a strong culture of engineering excellence, customer obsession, ownership and camaraderieBasic Qualifications4+ years of total software development experience as a frontend or full stack developerBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field, or equivalent working experienceExperience building with web development programming languages such as Javascript, Typescript, HTML and CSSPreferred QualificationsExperience working with web application development frameworks such as Nodejs, React, Redux, Angular, Next or similarExperience or knowledge of programming languages such as Java, Go, C++, C#, PythonExperience working on scalable backend services utilizing a microservices architectureExperience building and shipping features end-to-end (frontend and backend) in partnership with Product Managers and UX DesignersHigh bar for quality as demonstrated by code reviews, documentation, unit and integration testingAt Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 10,000 cities around the world.We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let's move the world forward, together.Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.Apply NowSee our Candidate Privacy Statement>  Uber is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. fields.description: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA; Seattle, WA, USAMinimum qualifications: Bachelors degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience. 2 years of experience as a software engineer, developer, or equivalent technical experience. Experience in a technical consulting or client facing capacity. Experience working with JavaScript, Java, Kotlin, PHP, Python, Ruby, Node.js, Go, iOS, Android Mobile App development, and/or web technologies.Preferred qualifications: Experience working with third party developer tools, including documentation, APIs, SDKs, and client libraries. Experience participating in online and offline developer communities and ecosystems (e.g., open source platforms, blogs, YouTube video series, tech conferences, hackathons, meet ups, technical teaching, and training).About the jobAs a Developer Programs Engineer, you love connecting with developers and speaking externally about technologies on conference panels, at meet ups, and on blogs. Your work fosters a community of developers integrating with Google technologies and helps to drive strategy around Developer Relations.In this role, you'll work on our YouTube channels, in podcasts and trainings, or support channels to troubleshoot and debug technical problems encountered by developers. Internally, you'll work with product engineering teams to improve products by conveying feedback from developers, reviewing and contributing to API designs, writing production ready code, and testing new features.In Developer Relations, we collaborate and connect with communities that love technology as much as we do. Our team interacts with developers across the globe both at conferences as well as online, and advocates for third party developer interests and needs internally at Google. Our focus is on supporting third party developers who build applications and businesses on Google's platforms. Not afraid to be hands-on, you might write sample code, author client libraries, work with strategic Google partners, and facilitate and organize our developer communities.Responsibilities Manage and participate in developer discussion forums, troubleshoot and address the concerns raised in these forums; educate developers on best practices for effective integration of Google developer products. Assist third-party developers and strategic partners in troubleshooting integrations with Google APIs and use of other Google developer products online (e.g., through Stack Overflow). Work on the core source code of Google's products with other engineers to identify, reproduce, and fix issues that are affecting our users. Advocate for developers internally, and influence Google developer product strategy by working with Product Management, Go-to-Market, Product Engineering, Technical Support, PR, Marketing, Business Development and other cross-functional teams. Write, release, and manage open source Software Development Kits (SDKs), demo apps, tools, samples, blog posts, technical guides, or videos. Contribute to and manage open source projects and drive open standards.Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form
