fields.description: Skip to contentDashboardProfileAssessmentsReportJobsCommunityEarn $2000Render logoUX EngineerSan Francisco, CA, United StatesRenderRole LocationSan Francisco, CA, United StatesEmployees11 - 25 peopleAddress655 5 Th St Apt 19San Francisco, CA, 94107, USTech StackReactGraphQLKubernetesGoPostgreSQLDockerTypeScriptRole DescriptionWhen deploying applications in production, developers are forced to pick between two extremes: expensive yet simplistic platforms like Heroku, or complicated, do-it-all-yourself services like AWS. By contrast, Render makes it easy to get up and running quickly but also allows applications to scale and increase in complexity over time, preventing a transition to DIY infrastructure.Our goal is to completely free up developers and teams from managing infrastructure. This will ultimately improve all software and enable entirely new kinds of applications.We're building products that abstract over complexity and minimize cognitive overhead for our customers. This requires careful thought, high creativity and a deep understanding of application requirements in production. We believe that the best UX is invisible, and we strive to exceed customer expectations with a product that is incredibly intuitive and delightful, even in the tiniest of details. We're looking for engineers with high integrity, low ego, and an insatiable drive to learn. Our platform serves over a billion requests every month and we have tens of thousands of users including Cypress.io, Bloomscape, NYU, and US presidential campaigns. We have product-market fit and rapidly increasing revenue, and we're backed by the same early stage investors behind Airbnb, Snap, and Stripe.As a UX engineer at Render, you will take ownership of the interactions and experiences of tens of thousands of developers as they use our platform. You will build visually appealing and intuitive interfaces that make developers want to use Render even if they don't have a project to host on it.You should already have a few years of experience building detailed product interactions and workflows. You should also have a keen understanding of UX design, and extensive experience collaborating with product and design teams in building complex frontend applications in React. Prior experience developing design systems is a plus.Engineering at RenderWe're a small team of world-class engineers. We have complete ownership for every project we take on and expect the same from you. We review all major code changes through pull requests, and are always pushing ourselves to do better. We iterate quickly and deploy to production several times a day.Why join usWe're solving a problem faced by every developer and development team. It's a massive and rapidly growing market (AWS is privately valued at over $200B, and there are over 30 million professional developers globally).Delightful UX is the one of the biggest differentiators for Render, and as our first UX engineer you will have tremendous impact on the product and company's trajectory.Everyone wants to move their infrastructure to Kubernetes, but it's too complex for the average development team. Render makes it possible to get the power of Kubernetes without any of its complexity.Top engineering leaders from VMware, Dropbox, Heroku and GitHub are some of our biggest investors and cheerleaders.The company is led by Anurag Goel, who was employee #8 and Head of Risk at Stripe. He helped Stripe scale from 10 to over 400 people and is applying many of the same principles that helped Stripe succeed to Render.What you will work onYou will work with the design team on Render's website and dashboard, continuously improving their visual appeal and ease of use.You will collaborate with Render engineers to build user interfaces for upcoming products and features.You will create high fidelity prototypes to help find solutions to thorny interaction problems.You will create unit and integration tests for the frontend using tools like Jest and Enzyme, and end-to-end testing pipelines using tools like Cypress (a Render customer!)You will help accelerate the JavaScript to TypeScript migration in our frontend codebase.You will own the observability of user interactions and use this data to drive improvements across the board.You will create a world class onboarding experience for Render users and continue to refine it based on data.Some benefits we offerComprehensive medical, dental and vision coverage with PPO plans and 100% of your premiums paid by Render.99th percentile stock grants and a comfortable San Francisco salary.Four weeks paid vacation, and vacation days are only counted when you take more than one at a time.Work from home if you have a delivery or chore to take care of.3 months paid maternity and paternity leave.Commuter benefits including Lyft and SF Muni passes.A sunny, beautiful, well-stocked office in SoMa close to Caltrain and BART.Monthly gym membership allowance.Build your own laptop/workstation with any peripheral or accessory you need.Use the company card to order any work-related ebook or p-book, and buy anything to make your work environment more ergonomic.Financial and logistical assistance to help you relocate to the Bay Area.Immigration assistance.Birthday celebrations, weekly happy hours, company dinners, and semi-annual team retreats.Surprise gifts for the holidays!You are a great fit for this role ifYou have a few years of professional experience building complex frontend applications and experiences. Bonus points if youve excelled at a small, high-growth startup.You have a user-centric mindset and impressive attention to detail.You thrive in a collaborative environment and believe in direct, open and honest communication.You are self-directed, curious by nature and an impressively quick learner.You are unfazed by unfamiliar challenges and enjoy figuring things out on your own.Bonus points for experience developing design systems and conducting user research.The ideal candidate would check everything above but you should certainly apply if you identify with most of it.Working at RenderWe value high integrity, low ego, an affinity for continuous learning, and the ability to figure things out quickly. We're always open to being wrong, and we love to improve our work through reasoned discussion and constant feedback. We trust and respect each other tremendously which makes doing all of this easy.We'd love to hear from you!About RenderWhen deploying applications in production, developers are forced to pick between two extremes: expensive yet simplistic platforms like Heroku, or complicated, do-it-all-yourself services like AWS. By contrast, Render makes it easy to get up and running quickly but also allows applications to scale and increase in complexity over time, preventing a transition to DIY infrastructure.Our goal is to completely free up developers and teams from managing infrastructure. This will ultimately improve all software and enable entirely new kinds of applications.We're building products that abstract over complexity and minimize cognitive overhead for our users. This requires careful thought, high creativity and a deep understanding of application requirements in production. Our stack is React, GraphQL, Go, Kubernetes and PostgreSQL, but we don't require prior experience with any of them. We're looking for people with high integrity, low ego, and an insatiable drive to learn.We serve over 150 million requests every week and have thousands of users who love the product. Our users include a leading democratic presidential campaign, YC startups, indie hackers and everyone in between. The company is well funded and backed by the same venture funds behind Airbnb, Snap, and Stripe, and the former CTOs of VMware and Dropbox. We also won the annual TechCrunch Disrupt Battlefield last year.Company CultureWe value high integrity, low ego, an affinity for continuous learning, and the ability to figure things out quickly. We're always open to being wrong, and we love to improve our work through reasoned discussion and constant feedback. We trust and respect each other tremendously which makes doing all of this easy.Other Roles at RenderRender logoBackend EngineerSan Francisco, CA, United StatesRender logoFull-Stack EngineerSan Francisco, CA, United StatesRender logoProduct EngineerSan Francisco, CA, United StatesABOUTMANIFESTOOPEN SOURCE DONATIONSSOFTWARE ENGINEER SALARYSOFTWARE ENGINEERING JOBSDIVERSITYPRESSFAQBLOGCONTACTCAREERSPrivacy CenterPrivacy PolicyTerms and Conditions

fields.description: Skip to contentDashboardProfileAssessmentsReportJobsCommunityEarn $2000Vectrix logoSoftware Engineer, FrontendRemote, San Francisco, CA, United States  $95k - $120k  0.02% - 0.50%VectrixRole LocationsRemoteSan Francisco, CA, United StatesCompensation$95k - $120k0.02% - 0.50%Employees< 10 peopleAddress897 Columbus AveSan Francisco, CA, 94133-2307, USTech StackReactJavaScriptReact NativePythonFlaskAWSRole DescriptionVectrix.io, a cloud security company part of Y Combinator's Summer 2020 batch, is looking a Senior Software Engineer, Frontend.The Vectrix platform allows companies to connect their third-party cloud services (e.g., AWS, GitHub, G Suite) to get security monitoring coverage over each of them, instantly. We do this by offering a growing library of individual, easy-to-use security scanners that each monitor a specific service for a specific issue. Active security engineers develop and monetize their scanners, we vet and host them, and companies pick, choose, and integrate the security coverage that matters to them.Read about Vectrix in TechCrunchCheck out the platform by signing up here: https://app.vectrix.io/signupAbout the role:As the first hire on the Vectrix team, you will influence and drive technical and product decisions that will leave a lasting impression on the company - and the industry - for years to come.Working closely with the founding team, your purview as employee number one will cover the development, support, and scalability of the Vectrix platform. You will report to our CTO, Matt, working together to develop the foundation on which cloud security is improved for companies and security teams around the world.This role is best suited for you if you are someone who is looking to tackle exciting problems in cybersecurity, continuously grow as an individual, and want to have direct, measurable impact on the outcomes we experience as a company.Your technical responsibilities:Lead frontend development of the web application (React SPA).Aid in UI/UX design of web application.Integrate with and occasionally aid in building backend components.About you:Strong Javascript development skills, especially with React.Strong understanding of design/architectural patterns and core web technology.Strong UI/UX design skills.Experience with Restful APIs.Experience working on backend when necessary (Python 3, Flask, etc.).Ability to write secure, testable, and efficient code.An understanding of basic performance optimization and scalability for web applications.2+ years' experience in an engineering or development role.Practical thinker: understand how to optimize time effectively to balance creation of tech debt while shipping features as fast as possible.Bonus:Background within security. (huge plus!)Experience working in cloud native environments (AWS, GCP).Experience with Docker and Kubernetes (EKS, GKE, K8s the Hard Way).Good understanding of SQL and NoSQL databases and how to use them efficiently.Great at troubleshooting and debugging issues.Excels at communicating complex issues in an easy to understand way.A 4 year degree in Computer Science, or equivalent in years experience.Were looking for teammates who are:Dependable: You're a real team player; someone that can be counted on and counts on others.Self-starting: You are ready to take on the world... as well as that really annoying bug causing headaches.Curious: You're excited and motivated by learning and doing... and then learning some more.Emotionally intelligent: You place value in understanding your colleagues and who they are.Problem solvers: You default to action and find a way to solve even the trickiest of problems.The tech stack:We're cloud first in all that we do. Our backend is built in Flask and is based on a micro service architecture running within Docker and AWS EKS (Kubernetes). Our backend utilizes AWS services like S3, RDS, EC2, and Lambda. We use React on the frontend and leverage Material UI and Bootstrap for the majority of UI components. We live in Slack, but code lives in GitHub. We leverage Notion and Gitbooks for documentation.Benefits:Competitive salary with early employee equityMedical, Dental and Vision benefit packagesFlexible working hoursHome office setup allowanceTake What You Need vacation policy11 holidays a year (including Election Day) and we close the half day before each HolidayPaid parental leave for all parentsMore about Vectrix:We're an experienced team of thinkers and doers with a passion for bringing security and people together. We value new ideas and find that learning everyday is just as essential as breathing.But don't be mistaken - we are on a mission. A mission to empower the security community with a platform that will change an entire industry for the better, one secure cloud service at a time.About VectrixVectrix is the first SaaS platform for one-click cloud and SaaS security scanners. Simply choose the coverage you need, connect your accounts, and start monitoring for critical security issues instantly, like misconfigurations, suspicious activity, and more. Whether it's AWS and GitHub or G Suite and Salesforce, Vectrix has you covered.Founded by former security engineers and security leaders at PlanGrid, Vimeo, and Autodesk, Vectrix equips engineers and growing security teams with an easy, effective way to bootstrap cloud and SaaS security.Learn more at https://vectrix.ioCompany CultureWe're an experienced team of thinkers and doers with a passion for bringing security and people together. We value new ideas and find that learning everyday is just as essential as breathing. Some of our values include:Do the right thing, always - Even when it's hard. Even when no one is watching. Even when it may hurt or be uncool. We value the legacy we'll leave on people we interact with and reflect on such impacts often.Cohesion over correctness - We win together. And when we get it wrong, we do so together. And then we fix it. Together. When we don't see eye to eye, we disagree and commit.Default to action - We will have won or lost not by what we did not do, but by what action we took. We strike the perfect balance of knowing when to pause to think critically and shipping with haste. We value growth over perfection. Speed is an ally. We celebrate our wins, but for just long enough. Momentum, momentum, momentum!Other Roles at VectrixVectrix logoSoftware Engineer, Full-StackSan Francisco, CA, United States or RemoteABOUTMANIFESTOOPEN SOURCE DONATIONSSOFTWARE ENGINEER SALARYSOFTWARE ENGINEERING JOBSDIVERSITYPRESSFAQBLOGCONTACTCAREERSPrivacy CenterPrivacy PolicyTerms and Conditions

fields.description: Backend Rails Engineer DevelopmentAffiniPay is looking for Backend Rails Engineers to help build our payment processing platform. Our custom platform is built for processing large transactions in a highly secure environment for our clients nationwide and is the leader in the industry. Youll help us create and implement new features to our existing platform, release the next version of our AffiniPay product, and improve security and usability for our clients. As a Backend Rails Engineer at AffiniPay, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining our internal and external applications using Ruby on Rails, as well as JavaScript libraries like jQuery and React.Responsibilities:Engage in technical discussions and design of new solutions and architecturesCollaborating with our product team on new and existing features to improve user experience and usabilityDetermining feasibility & scalability of front end solutions and guiding the technical design accordinglyOwning the implementation of new features for both our internal and external Rails applications (and longer term, other technologies)Working to improve processes and technologies Mentoring and pairing with other developers on the teamContributing to code reviews with other engineers in order to maintain and improve qualityDeploying and managing applications, including static frontend applications, in AWS alongside our operations teamRequirements:BS in Computer Science or Engineering, or equivalent work experienceDemonstrable track record of building, deploying, and monitoring large scale, high availability web applicationsExperience with SQL, and familiarity with databases such as Postgres or MySqlA passion for guiding and mentoring developers of varying experience levelsExperience solving large-application/user-level problems, performance, scalability, etc.Practices Test-Driven Development and/or Behavior-Driven DevelopmentProficient at debugging complex problems using interactive development tools, logs, and/or IDEWillingness to work in multiple programming languages and frameworksWell-rounded knowledge of distributed systems and software architectureBonus points for Rails experienceExperience using Docker a plusFamiliarity with the Unix/Linux shell environmentAbout AffiniPayAt AffiniPay, were continuously tackling exciting and interesting problems to define the direction of the financial technology industry and transform the way professionals get paid! Our drive to become leaders in fintech has fostered our fast-moving, growth-focused culture. Weve assembled teams of highly collaborative problem solvers who are passionate about both personal and company growth. We are eager to create, work together, and do whatever it takes to get the job done. We also know that our people are our greatest asset and responsible for our ultimate success. As such, we invest in our team-members growth and development, recognize accomplishments, and celebrate successes together. Were building a winning team, and we need more creative, collaborative, and fun-loving people to help us get the job done! Affini-Perks! We've got you covered...Competitive compensation structure401K with automatic 5% company contribution100% paid medical, dental, and vision benefit plans100% Company paid short- and long-term disability and life insuranceOpen PTO planPaid maternity/paternity leaveFun offsite quarterly meetingsAffiniPay Swag PackageCompany lunches and fully stocked kitchenAll the benefits of a startup culture without the downsidesThe chance to get in on the ground floor of one of Austin's fastest growing companies!AffiniPay is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

fields.description: JOB DESCRIPTIONJob Description As a Front-End Software Engineer at Specific Energy, you will work on a team that develops and maintains the customer-facing user interface for all our products. Our front-end team is responsible for delivering a high-quality user experience on desktop and mobile devices. You will be contributing to an interface that is used by companies around the world to monitor and maintain their industrial equipment.Specific Energy has been around for 10 years and has the benefit of an established installed base and proven run-time.   We are a small company and require everyone to wear multiple hats. As a Front-End Software Engineer you would have the unique opportunity to get in on the ground floor of an emerging technology company and play a key role in growing this business and gaining mainstream market adoption.ResponsibilitiesDeliver best-in-class user experience for our customersWork closely with the back-end development teamDesign new user interfaces and components Mock-up designs in Sketch or FigmaIterate designs based on user feedbackQualifications 3+ years of experience building web applications with JavaScript (ES6), HTML5, and CSSExperience working on SaaS applicationsFamiliarity with bug & error tracking platformsFamiliarity with good software development practicesAbility to write performant JavaScriptBS in computer science, engineering, or related technical fieldStrong communication skillsPreferred QualificationsiOS development experienceUX design experienceAndroid development experienceExperience with front-end analytics platforms

fields.description: At First Republic, we care about our people. Founded in 1985, we offer extraordinary client service in private banking, private business banking and private wealth management. We believe that personal connections are everything and our success is driven by the relationships we form with our colleagues and clients. Youll always feel empowered and valued here.  Putting you firstAs an intern, you will gain hands-on experience at a high-growth company that values its people. Youll earn a competitive starting wage while absorbing a culture that emphasizes collaboration, entrepreneurial thinking and quick decision-making. Start doing the best work of your life here. Information ServicesFirst Republic Bank is looking for software engineers to help grow our core services team and participate in the development of application software that will be used in production.  Youll get to work in a professional environment and get exposure to how enterprise software is built and deployed at a financial institution.  Youll also get to work in fun environment that celebrates creativity with interesting people. What youll do as a Software EngineerYoull be assigned to work with in a dedicated feature team building infrastructure for First Republic Bank.Developing middleware or DevOps code that will ultimately be used by the bank.Learn software development process that related to financial institutions.Familiarize with secure software development. You could be a great fit if you have:Proficiency in a managed language: e.g. C#, Java, etc.Proficiency in a scripted language such as Python or TerraformKnowledge of how the web works and experience with web-based markupSome experience working in the cloud: e.g. Azure, AWS, etc.Major in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalentJob Demands:Must be able to review and analyze data reports and manuals; must be computer proficient.Must be able to communicate effectively via telephone and in person.Own your work and your career - apply nowAre you willing to take initiative and make decisions? Are you willing to go the extra mile because you love what you do and how you can contribute as a team? Do you want the freedom to grow and the opportunity to take charge of your own career? If so, then come join us. We want hard working team players. Youll have the independence to learn, lead and drive change. A culture of extraordinary service, empowerment and stabilitythats the First Republic way. This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. The Company is an equal opportunity employer. In this regard, the Company makes reasonable accommodations for qualified applicants and employees with disabilities in order to enable them to perform all essential job functions, unless doing so creates an undue hardship. First Republic is subject to federal laws that restrict the employment of individuals with certain types of criminal histories, including FDIA Section 19 and FINRA. To the extent not inconsistent with our obligations under those federal laws and regulations, First Republic will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Los Angeles and San Francisco ban-the-box laws.Share on your newsfeedNeed help finding the right job?We can recommend jobs specifically for you! Click here to get started.Please be advised that First Republic Bank will not ask you to provide personal information, including driver's licenses, social security numbers, and passports during the interview process. If you receive a request of this type, please report it to Fraud@firstrepublic.com

fields.description: Skip to Main Content Welcome pageWelcome pageJoseph SavettDashboard | Log OutContingent Full Stack Software EngineerID 2020-10328 Job Locations US-CA-San Francisco Category Banking Your application was submitted successfully. Thank you for applying.    Customer PlatformTo lookup the Platform that needs servicing, enter the Platform Number or type "icims.com" in the search field. At First Republic, we care about our people. Founded in 1985, we offer extraordinary client service in private banking, private business banking and private wealth management. We believe that personal connections are everything and our success is driven by the relationships we form with our colleagues and clients. Youll always feel empowered and valued here.  Incredible teams doing exceptional work, every dayIn Technology, we support First Republics employees and clients through the acquisition, integration and management of the Banks information technology systems and services. We drive innovation and explore emerging technologies so our people can be productive and focus on what matters most  providing extraordinary service. As an engineer, youll be part of a small team that develops and manages a heavily used internal application by our bankers to serve our clients. This team is passionate about adding business value by means of delivering high quality technical solutions and offering exceptional support to our business partners. What youll do as a Full Stack Software Engineer:Involvement in the end to end software life cycle  from birth of an idea to continued production support.Extract technical specs from business requirements and implement a solution with a foresight to be scalable and maintainable.Develop and prepare documents for the general design of solutions that meet system and security requirements.Work closely with business analysts and other technical partners in driving the projects and see through to completion.Take ownership and responsibility of your deliverables and communicate proactively You could be a great fit if you have:Well-versed in .NET web Development. Experience with both ASP.NET and ASP.NET MVC framework. Proficient in .net core and entity framework core.Strong experience in C# as programming language with LINQ and Entity Framework.Strong experience in SQL server backend. Ability to write complex stored procedures, queries and optimize for performance.Has an eye for front-end development and fluent in HTML, CSS & JavaScript. Able to develop modern, rich UI.Experience working in a MEAN/MERN stack and proficiency with REACT framework.Have strong experience in enterprise application integration including SOA, BPM, APIs, Web Services (SOAP/RESTful), Micro Services, Containerization (Open Shift Containers, Kubernetes and etc.)Hands on Experience in Middleware technologies (Mule soft, Kafka, Lambda)Hand on experience working with API gateway solutions (Apigee, Mulesoft Anypoint platform, AWS API Gateway)Expert level understanding of REST/SOAP paradigm and sync vs Async integration design and architectureExperience with AWS CloudHave experience in DevOps stack (CI & CD) and other dependency management and build tools such as Jenkins, Gradle, Maven, Ant and IvyStrong experience with NoSQL and relational data storesExperience writing unit and integration tests with testing frameworksFamiliarity with monitoring related tools and frameworks like Splunk, ElasticSearch, AppDynamics or new Relic.Some experience in node.js and Python is nice to have.Experience working in an Agile/SCRUM environment.Excellent debugging and troubleshooting skills.Understands DevOps and experience with tooling such as Docker, Jenkins, OpenShift etc.Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Personal Skills/CompetencyA positive, enthusiastic attitude and the ambition to tackle challenging issuesLooks toward the broadest possible view of an issue/ challenge; can easily pose future scenarios; can think globally about all aspects of the Bank; can discuss multiple considerations of an issue and forecast them into the future; understands how the Bank works, competes, serves clients, and generates shareholder valueNegotiates skillfully in tough situations with internal and external groups; can be both direct and diplomaticOutstanding verbal and written communications skills with the ability to listen, articulate positions, and influence outcomes beyond direct areas of ownershipConsistently demonstrates and follows high standards of integrity in business decision-making Job demands:Must be able to review and analyze data reports and manuals; must be computer proficient.Must be able to communicate effectively via telephone and in person. Own your work and your career - apply nowAre you willing to take initiative and make decisions? Are you willing to go the extra mile because you love what you do and how you can contribute as a team? Do you want the freedom to grow and the opportunity to take charge of your own career? If so, then come join us. We want hard working team players. Youll have the independence to learn, lead and drive change. A culture of extraordinary service, empowerment and stabilitythats the First Republic way. Come join us! This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. The Company is an equal opportunity employer. In this regard, the Company makes reasonable accommodations for qualified applicants and employees with disabilities in order to enable them to perform all essential job functions, unless doing so creates an undue hardship. First Republic is subject to federal laws that restrict the employment of individuals with certain types of criminal histories, including FDIA Section 19 and FINRA. To the extent not inconsistent with our obligations under those federal laws and regulations, First Republic will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Los Angeles and San Francisco ban-the-box laws.Share on your newsfeedNeed help finding the right job?We can recommend jobs specifically for you! fields.description: 1PROFILEJOBSMORESEARCHMacallan Savett avatarAvatar for MeroxaMeroxaReal time data streaming platform as a serviceShareFollowOverviewPeopleCultureFundingJobs3Software Engineer - Frontend$150k  $230k  0.1%  1.5%Apply nowMeroxa is looking for talented engineers that are obsessed with creating intuitive, data-centric developer experiences. Currently to build real time data infrastructure, it means choosing between taking 6+ months to integrate a commercial product, 6+ months and your most skilled engineers' time to cobble together open source projects, or hiring a specialized team of experts at $200k+ per person to build and maintain your systems. We believe everyone regardless of expertise, company size, or available resources should be able to leverage real time data infrastructure in minutes not months.Who you are...You are a frontend engineer who pays attention to detail and possesses the dedication to deliver a high-quality, stable customer experiences. To be successful, you must be self-motivated, be driven to achieve and exceed expectations. You also need to exude strong collaboration skills, including the ability to mentor and be mentored. You possess a strong passion to work in a growing, energizing environment of innovation. If you want to be part of this amazing team, this position is for you.Opportunities for impact:Empower our customers to build complex data pipelines via a UIConnect the seams of our ecosystem of tools together in the form of connected, end-to-end workflowsCollaborate with the CTO, Design, and Product to scope and plan engineering efforts and identify dependenciesProjects you may work on:Self serve dashboard that allows our users regardless of technical ability to create real time data pipelinesTurning our design system, Flow, into reusable componentsInternal dashboards and tooling to increase our ability to identify and debug issues fasterRequirements:Strong JavaScript development experience.Proficient in at least one JavaScript framework like Ember, React, VueJS, or equivalentExperience with CSS3 and LESS/Sass (ability to write mixins, partials, functions, etc) and usage in large scale applicationsExperience in Single Page Application architectureProficient knowledge of Git, NPM/YarnStrong experience with cross browser compatibility and optimization techniquesStrong understanding of debugging scalable, high performance web applications built with reusability and componentization in mindExperience with testing frameworks and capable of learning new programming languagesExperience designing and implementing APIs for broad use.Detail oriented and dedication to qualityStrong interpersonal skills and the ability to share/collaborate with peersEmpathy for your users.Benefits we offer:Competitive salaries - We know you're in high demand, so we aim to be in the top 10% of salaries based on what you'd make as a Silicon Valley engineer.Remote work - Work from where you want to inside the continental US. We've been a remote first company from day one. Also, we supply whatever hardware and software you need to do your job from home.Health, dental, & vision - Meroxa offers PPO and HMO plans for you, your family, or domestic partner. We pay 75% and you pay 25%Unlimited vacation - We know you'll love working at Meroxa so much that you'll want to stay heads down every day and night but seriously we want you to take the time you need to bring your best self to work.Paid parental leave - When you welcome a new baby, Meroxa encourages you to take up to 16 weeks leave as primary caregiver and up to 6 weeks leave as secondary caregiver, at 100% paid salary.And more... We're constantly looking at ways we can improve our employee experience through service offerings(401k, student loan payback, discount programs, self service training, mental health, etc...)About Meroxa:Meroxa was founded by DeVaris Brown and Ali Hamidi. We've spent years working together building the world's best PaaS experience for web apps at Heroku and want to bring that same magical experience to the data ecosystem.We've been building our platform since early 2020 and are backed by some amazing investors(Root Ventures, Amplify Partners, Village Global, and Hustle Fund) and angels who've been in senior engineering and leadership roles at companies like GitHub, Looker, Heroku, Datadog, Autodesk, WePay, and TheRealReal.Meroxa is an equal opportunity employer and celebrates diversity. If youre smart and good at what you do, come as you are. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, and disability status.Apply nowLocationSan Francisco Bay Area  RemoteHires remotelyEverywhereJob typeFull-timeVisa sponsorshipNot AvailableHiring contactDeVaris BrownCEO  10 monthsAvatar for DeVaris BrownMore jobs at MeroxaView all jobsSoftware Engineer - fields.description: Junior Full Stack EngineerJunior Full Stack EngineerBetterHelp  Mountain View, CALINKSCOMPANY STORYBetterHelp is the worlds largest counseling service. We connect people who face life's challenges with a provider from our broad network of licensed, accredited, and board-certified therapists. Every month, consumers and therapists use our website and mobile app to facilitate over 1,000,000 secured messages, chats, voice calls, and video sessions. Our mission is to provide everyone with an easy, affordable, and private access to professional counseling, anytime, anywhere.Read how we affected people's lives: betterhelp.com/reviewsLOCATION440 N. Wolfe Rd,, Mountain View, CA AreaREMOTE/ONSITEOnsiteINDUSTRIESHealthTech, WellnessFOUNDED2013SIZE70 employeesFINANCIAL NOTES2015-01-01: Acquired by TeladocMUST-HAVE SKILLSLINUXMYSQLNGINXMANUAL TESTINGSQLJOB DESCRIPTIONJunior Full Stack Engineer- Mountain View, CAWe help people change their lives. BetterHelp is the worlds largest counseling  service. In 2013 we set out on a mission to provide everyone with easy, affordable, and private access to professional counseling - anytime,   anywhere. Today, our network of over 10,000 licensed, accredited, and board-certified   therapists have assisted more than a million people face life challenges.  Every month, our secure website and mobile app facilitate over five million messages, chats, voice calls, and video sessions each month that help people change their lives.We are a community that grows together - both professionally   and personally. Even   with our exponential growth, our team is kept agile and nimble, allowing you   to have a huge impact and carve your own path from day one. We invest in our   peoples well-being and upward mobility because we know that business and   individual growth go hand-in-hand.RequirementsThis is the perfect place for junior level engineers to start out and grow their  full stack web development skillset. Manual testing is a part of the role, but engineers at all levels share the manual testing burden. Our QA Engineers  are mainly focused on bug triage; handling bug reports, reproducing them, investigating the code and ultimately writing fixes that get deployed to production. We are looking for an engineer with good attention to detail, the ability to learn quickly and pick up new skills independently, and a get-things-done attitude with eagerness to build something awesome!What will you do? Work with a nimble passionate team; collaborating with development and support.Write test scripts and SQL queries, work with various automation tools and   debuggers utilizing the full stack.Bug triage: handle incoming bug reports, go beyond investigating and write bug fixes   yourself.Maintain a continuous integration server, design new tests.Manual testing: reading code, figuring out what might break and breaking it before   it reaches production.Use your detective work to get to the AH-HA! moment when you find the root cause   of an issue and figure out how to fix it.You  will care and be involved in our product, mission, and success - way beyond   checking off tasks.What technologies will you work with?
